sections.title: The Black Panther Party's Free Breakfast Program
content: The Black Panther Party's Free Breakfast for Children Program began in January 1969 at St. Augustine's Church in Oakland. This revolutionary program fed thousands of children daily before school, addressing food insecurity while building community power.

The program eventually spread to feed tens of thousands of children daily in 45 programs across the country. It demonstrated how communities could directly meet their own needs while challenging systemic inequalities.

sections.title: Principles of Mutual Aid
content: Mutual aid is rooted in the belief that we all have something to contribute and we all have something to learn. It's about building community power through direct action and solidarity.

principles.name: SOLIDARITY
principles.description: Standing together in shared struggle, recognizing our interconnection

principles.name: DIRECT ACTION
principles.description: Taking immediate action to meet community needs without waiting for permission

principles.name: COMMUNITY POWER
principles.description: Building collective strength to create lasting systemic change

sections.title: Modern Mutual Aid Movement
content: Today's mutual aid movement builds on centuries of community care practices, particularly those developed by marginalized communities who have been excluded from traditional support systems.
From disaster response to ongoing community support, mutual aid networks demonstrate that we can create the world we want to live in through direct action and collective care.

quote.text: Mutual aid is not charity. Charity is hierarchical, often humiliating, and comes with strings attached. Mutual aid is based in love and solidarity.
quote.author: Dean Spade
